;;T;;HE SCENE; had the trappings of a cartel bust. 4月5日，厄瓜多尔警察身穿巴拉克拉法帽，携带防暴盾牌，乘坐装甲车抵达逮捕豪尔赫·格拉斯。但格拉斯先生并不是帮派头目，他是厄瓜多尔前副总统。 He took refuge in Mexico's embassy in Quito, Ecuador's capital, in December to avoid being arrested on charges of corruption—and was granted asylum Ecuador barged in and grabbed him anyway.

;

;Mexico condemned the arrest as an “authoritarian act” and recalled its diplomats.厄瓜多尔违反外交规范之际，使馆建筑的不可侵犯性正面临越来越大的压力。 Days before the raid, the Iranian government warned Israel that its embassies were “no longer safe” after a suspected Israeli air strike ;destroyed an Iranian consular building; in Damascus, Syria's capital. What protections are afforded to diplomatic premises and why do they matter?

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;Norms for how governments should treat foreign embassies stretch back centuries.古希腊和罗马政府对外国使节及其使团给予保护。 1961 年，这些规则在《维也纳外交关系公约》中正式确定。 Article 22 states that diplomatic premises are inviolable.未经大使或使团团长同意，当地警察或安全部队不得进入使馆。东道国有义务保护场地。 People working there are immune from prosecution under the host country's laws. Some governments grumble that this allows embassies to shelter seedy characters. But the rules are important: they allow diplomats to work without fear of being harassed or taken hostage, and can help preserve stability between countries with testy relations.

;

;The consequences of breaching inviolability can be severe.美国国务院认为对其大使馆的袭击就是对美国本身的袭击。事实上，大使馆的特殊地位只是偶尔受到严重考验。 In 1979, with the backing of Iran's new revolutionary Islamist government, student activists scaled the walls of the American embassy in Tehran and held hostage more than 50 American diplomats for 444 days. The International Court of Justice (;ICJ;) swiftly ruled against Iran. Relations between the two countries have never recovered, and Iran remains an international pariah.

;

;Some governments have sought to crack down on abuses of inviolability. Following the murder of Yvonne Fletcher, a police officer killed in a London square in 1984 by a shooter in the Libyan embassy, Britain passed a law to remove protection for diplomatic premises that were being misused. To date, the law has only been used only once, to clear squatters who had commandeered the long-vacant Cambodian embassy. The British government considered using the act again in 2012 after Julian Assange, the founder of WikiLeaks, sought refuge in Ecuador's embassy in London to avoid extradition to Sweden on charges of sexual assault. (Those charges were later dropped, but Mr Assange was arrested by British police after Ecuador revoked his asylum in 2019, and is ;fighting extradition; to America, where he is charged with hacking government computers.)

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;There are exceptions to inviolability under international law, too. The Vienna Convention only refers to the responsibilities of the host state, but says nothing about a third-party attack. Also, under the laws of armed conflict, embassies lose their protections if they are used for military purposes. That may mean that the recent strike on Iran's consulate in Damascus was legal; a spokesperson for the Israel Defence Forces called the annexe that was destroyed a “military building [...] disguised as a civilian building”. Iran may try to claim, falsely, that the same is true of Israeli embassies, and that attacks on them would be similarly justified.

;

;Mexico announced it would file a complaint against Ecuador at the ;ICJ;. The court is likely to rule in its favour, but its ability to punish Ecuador may be limited. Other countries have condemned the raid, which may signal a raft of incoming sanctions. Ecuador could also be booted out of the Organisation of American States, a regional talking-shop. But the country's strongman president, Daniel Noboa, seems to be betting that the raid will boost his popularity domestically. By nabbing the disgraced former vice-president, he is hoping to burnish his reputation for being tough on crime. Yet he is also adding to global lawlessness.;■;

;; T;;HE INDIA; I grew up in had just secured its independence and was struggling to meet essential needs like food, fuel and foreign exchange. It is now the world's second-largest food producer, measured by calorie content, and a net food exporter.印度仍然进口燃料，但越来越多地利用太阳能和风能。外汇储备创历史新高。 India is now the world's fifth-largest economy and some analysts predict it could be the third-largest by 2027.

;

;In the past, during negotiations with the multilateral organisations and investors, India would often be described as a country of great potential that would remain one. For many years the gibe may not have been entirely unfair: India progressed in fits and starts.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;The balance-of-payments crisis in 1991-93 was an important course correction for macroeconomic stability and structural reforms. 1996 年和 1998-2004 年，在阿塔尔·比哈里·瓦杰帕伊 (Atal Bihari Vajpayee) 的领导下，发生了进一步的重大变化：电信和公路网络得到了扩展，提高了生产力，将欠发达地区与先进地区结合起来，并刺激了印度制造业的竞争。 The Fiscal Responsibility and Budget Management (;FRBM;) Act of 2003 marked another turning point, underlining the importance of economic stability for private investment. But then reforms slowed from 2004 to 2014.

;

;During the past ten years, however, India has decisively disproved the “country of potential” quip 。 The ;IMF; describes the country as an economic “bright spot”. Research by the State Bank of India finds a steady decline in the incremental capital-output ratio—a measure of the relationship between investment and increase in ;GDP;—to 4.4 in the latest April-to-March financial year, compared to 7.5 a decade before. This suggests that part of India's growth stems from producing more with less.

;

;India has set itself the target of becoming a developed economy by 2047, the year that marks the centenary of its independence. What issues does it need to focus on to get there?

;

;The first is poverty. Eliminating it must be the raison d'être of any meaningful economic strategy for a densely populated country of 1.4bn people. If you accept India's official definition of poverty—just under $2 of income a day—then rural poverty is estimated at 2.5% and urban poverty at 1%.这些估计未考虑各种政府计划提供的免费食品和其他直接转移福利。尽管如此，印度应该瞄准更高的目标。 Poverty must be brought down, and this should be done while raising the official definition from the current level to at least $3 of daily income, ideally $3.50.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;The second task is to maintain macroeconomic stability by implementing the ;FRBM; act. Under this law, the fiscal deficit was to be reduced to 3% of ;GDP; for both central and state governments, and the debt-to-;GDP; ratio was to be reduced to 60%。 Twenty years later this still has not happened.

;

;The increased public spending needed to handle the covid-19 pandemic made those goals even more elusive. Since the pandemic, however, the situation has improved: the budget estimate of the likely fiscal deficit for the 2023-24 financial year indicates a narrowing, to 5.8% of ;GDP;, and the government hopes to reduce it to 4.5% in 2025-26. Public debt appears to be falling, too—towards 80% of ;GDP; compared to almost 90% in 2020-21. Alongside this, productivity will rise if the government continues to shift more of its spending into asset-creating capital projects.

;

;The third big issue is应对气候变化。印度正在通过 2015 年《巴黎协定》中的“国家自主贡献”积极发挥自己的作用。它也是部门倡议的领导者，例如由 118 个国家组成的政府间组织国际太阳能联盟。它已开始重组农业，减少对化石燃料的依赖，例如转向生产小米等能源密集度较低的谷物。 And it is ploughing money into green hydrogen.

;

;But India still has far to go to significantly reduce its dependence on fossil fuels.有序转型需要提高国有配电公司的效率，逐步淘汰效率低下的化石燃料发电厂，并加快向可再生能源供电电网的转变。国家层面的改变还不够。 It will also require international action, not least further reform of multilateral development banks, based on the recommendations of the ;G20;'s Independent Expert Group.

;

;The fourth area of concern is skills development. India's declining dependency ratio—the share of the population that is young or elderly—makes it all the more important to improve skills and roll out new technology, including, for instance, to provide better online courses. The government's new National Education Policy is putting the country on the right track. It may also help to bring much of the grey economy into the formal sector.

;

;India must develop a new model of growth, relying on technology instead of on more incremental and material-intensive manufacturing and export-led growth. India will never be a manufacturing-export powerhouse. Its best hope for future growth lies in focusing on capital expenditure and in further developing its service sectors.

;

;Geopolitical risks that make energy more expensive or interrupt critical supply chains will pose challenges. But they will not derail India. The country's recent stint chairing the ;G20,; and the resulting New Delhi Leaders' Declaration, showed how relations with America and Russia can be balanced, allowing India to, for instance, continue to import oil at affordable prices. As a large, growing market with much unsaturated demand, India is well placed to turn geopolitical uncertainties to its advantage.

;

;India's leaders have good reasons to want to achieve the four big goals.他们明白，政治稳定取决于强劲的经济增长以及通过技术支持的公共分配系统和各种补贴支付有效提供公共产品。 This may, finally, be India's moment. ;■;

;

;;NK Singh is an economist, a senior member of the Bharatiya Janata Party and president of the Institute of Economic Growth. He chaired the Fifteenth Finance Commission of India.;

;;R;;USSIA'S INVASION; has turned Ukraine into the world's most heavily mined country. In Kherson and Kharkhiv Russian soldiers left minefields when they retreated. As well as laying mines to defend their positions, they used them to disrupt Ukrainian farming. One Russian rocket system—known as ;zemledeliye; or “agriculture”—hurls mines up to 15km away from the launcher.农业是乌克兰经济的支柱：2021年农产品出口价值277亿美元，占出口总额的40%以上。 But since February 2022 7.5% of Ukraine's farmland is not currently in use, according to ;NASA;. There has been a human cost, too: 170 farmers have been killed, accounting for almost 20% of civilian deaths by landmines or unexploded ordnance, says Colonel Yevhenii Zubarevskyi, head of statistics at the defence ministry's Mine Action Directorate. With spring sowing under way, what is being done?

;

;When Russia's invasion began, only four outfits were authorised to run demining operations in Ukraine, besides the army and government bodies. Today that figure is 29, with a further 19 in the process of acquiring the requisite licences. But deminers are still overwhelmed. Proper clearance is difficult and expensive: teams start by interviewing locals and hunting for clues, like craters, that could suggest the presence of mines or unexploded shells, before going in with detection equipment and protective gear. Nibulon, a big Ukrainian grain exporter that has its own demining unit, charges farmers only for its expenses. Even then demining can cost more than $5,000 per hectare. Despite government subsidies, that is too costly for many farmers.尼布隆政府关系主管米哈伊洛·里扎克 (Mykhailo Rizak) 表示，有些人购买或租用了远离前线的土地。 Others, he laments, have taken matters into their own hands.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;;DIY ;demining is most common on small farms.前农业部副部长、现任乌克兰农民和私人土地所有者协会成员维克托·谢雷梅塔 (Viktor Sheremeta) 估计，他的 10,000 名会员中约有十分之一已经做到了这一点。在用金属探测器或长刺发现地雷后，大多数人都会向当局发出警报。 But some detonate the mines themselves—by throwing objects or using rollers on the front of tractors reinforced with  scrap-steel armour. This, of course, is very dangerous.

;

;A black market for demining has also sprung up.这些“黑暗排雷者”通过低工资雇用工人并且不为他们提供保险来提供低廉的工资。尽管许多此类排雷人员都是前战斗工程师，但他们往往缺乏处理最新地雷的经验。赫尔松地区的农民奥莱·乌什卡洛 (Oleh Ushkalo) 遇到无证排雷人员，提出以每公顷 100 美元左右的便宜价格清理他的土地。 He declined.俄罗斯士兵偷了他的联合收割机，他错过了收成，导致他缺乏现金。他也不信任承包商。他发现的一些地雷是用塑料包裹的，因此很难被发现。 Anti-tank mines on neighbouring farms, Mr Ushkalo says, killed seven tractor drivers.

;

;Typically, dark deminers are hired in places where Russian forces have passed through quickly without leaving dense minefields.它们在前线 20 公里范围内也更为常见，因为那里不允许非政府排雷人员进入。里扎克先生说，大多数人都是由不向税务员报告收成并希望避开政府监视的农场雇用的。 Tax evasion in agriculture, he adds, has become rife.

;

;The work of dark deminers is dangerously shoddy, putting them and their customers at risk 。糟糕的程序实际上可能会将地雷推到使检测和清除变得更加困难的位置。 Roughly half of all farmers killed by mines were in fields where improvised demining had taken place, says a Ukrainian security official.

;

;With most fields now thawed after last winter, improvised clearing is doubtless picking up.但总部位于基辅的慈善机构“炸弹技术无国界”的托尼·萨尔沃看到了一个令人鼓舞的迹象。由于伤亡不断增加，乌克兰警方已经认识到黑暗排雷的危险。过去，警察通常只在事故发生后才做出反应，现在他们正在主动调查黑暗排雷者。 A crackdown has begun.;■;
